mn16:2.1.pli: “Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pañca cetokhilā appahīnā, pañca cetasovinibandhā asamucchinnā, so vatimasmiṁ dhammavinaye vuddhiṁ virūḷhiṁ vepullaṁ āpajjissatīti—netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
mn16:2.1.en: “Mendicants, when a mendicant has not given up five kinds of emotional barrenness and cut off five emotional shackles, it’s not possible for them to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.

mn16:3.1.en: What are the five kinds of emotional barrenness they haven’t given up?

mn16:3.4.pli: Yassa cittaṁ na namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, evamassāyaṁ paṭhamo cetokhilo appahīno hoti.
mn16:3.4.en: This is the first kind of emotional barrenness they haven’t given up.

mn16:4.2.en: This is the second kind of emotional barrenness.

mn16:5.2.en: This is the third kind of emotional barrenness.

mn16:6.3.pli: Yassa cittaṁ na namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, evamassāyaṁ catuttho cetokhilo appahīno hoti.
mn16:6.3.en: This is the fourth kind of emotional barrenness.

mn16:7.3.pli: Yassa cittaṁ na namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, evamassāyaṁ pañcamo cetokhilo appahīno hoti.
mn16:7.3.en: This is the fifth kind of emotional barrenness they haven’t given up.

mn16:7.4.en: These are the five kinds of emotional barrenness they haven’t given up.

mn16:13.1.pli: Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno ime pañca cetokhilā appahīnā, ime pañca cetasovinibandhā asamucchinnā, so vatimasmiṁ dhammavinaye vuddhiṁ virūḷhiṁ vepullaṁ āpajjissatīti—netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
mn16:13.1.en: When a mendicant has not given up these five kinds of emotional barrenness and cut off these five emotional shackles, it’s not possible for them to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.

mn16:14.1.pli: Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pañca cetokhilā pahīnā, pañca cetasovinibandhā susamucchinnā, so vatimasmiṁ dhammavinaye vuddhiṁ virūḷhiṁ vepullaṁ āpajjissatīti—ṭhānametaṁ vijjati.
mn16:14.1.en: When a mendicant has given up these five kinds of emotional barrenness and cut off these five emotional shackles, it is possible for them to achieve growth, improvement, and maturity in this teaching and training.

mn16:15.1.en: What are the five kinds of emotional barrenness they’ve given up?

mn16:15.4.pli: Yassa cittaṁ namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, evamassāyaṁ paṭhamo cetokhilo pahīno hoti.
mn16:15.4.en: This is the first kind of emotional barrenness they’ve given up.

mn16:19.3.pli: Yassa cittaṁ namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, evamassāyaṁ pañcamo cetokhilo pahīno hoti.
mn16:19.3.en: This is the fifth kind of emotional barrenness they’ve given up.

mn16:19.4.en: These are the five kinds of emotional barrenness they’ve given up.

mn16:25.1.pli: Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno ime pañca cetokhilā pahīnā, ime pañca cetasovinibandhā susamucchinnā, so vatimasmiṁ dhammavinaye vuddhiṁ virūḷhiṁ vepullaṁ āpajjissatīti—ṭhānametaṁ vijjati.
mn16:25.1.en: When a mendicant has given up these five kinds of emotional barrenness and cut off these five emotional shackles, it is possible for them to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.

an10.14:1.1.pli: “Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā pañca cetokhilā appahīnā pañca cetasovinibandhā asamucchinnā, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati hāniyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no vuddhi.
an10.14:1.1.en: “Mendicants, a monk or nun who has not given up five kinds of emotional barrenness and has not cut off five emotional shackles can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

an10.14:2.1.en: What are the five kinds of emotional barrenness they haven’t given up?

an10.14:2.4.pli: Yassa cittaṁ na namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, evamassāyaṁ paṭhamo cetokhilo appahīno hoti.
an10.14:2.4.en: This is the first kind of emotional barrenness they haven’t given up.

an10.14:3.6.pli: Yassa cittaṁ na namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, evamassāyaṁ pañcamo cetokhilo appahīno hoti.
an10.14:3.6.en: This is the fifth kind of emotional barrenness they haven’t given up.

an10.14:3.7.en: These are the five kinds of emotional barrenness they haven’t given up.

an10.14:6.1.pli: Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā ime pañca cetokhilā appahīnā ime pañca cetasovinibandhā asamucchinnā, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati hāniyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no vuddhi.
an10.14:6.1.en: A monk or nun who has not given up these five kinds of emotional barrenness and has not cut off these five emotional shackles can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

an10.14:7.2.pli: evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā ime pañca cetokhilā appahīnā ime pañca cetasovinibandhā asamucchinnā, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati hāniyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no vuddhi.
an10.14:7.2.en: In the same way, monk or nun who has not given up these five kinds of emotional barrenness and has not cut off these five emotional shackles can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

an10.14:8.1.pli: Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā pañca cetokhilā pahīnā pañca cetasovinibandhā susamucchinnā, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no parihāni.
an10.14:8.1.en: A monk or nun who has given up five kinds of emotional barrenness and has cut off five emotional shackles can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

an10.14:9.1.en: What are the five kinds of emotional barrenness they’ve given up?

an10.14:9.4.pli: Yassa cittaṁ namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, evamassāyaṁ paṭhamo cetokhilo pahīno hoti.
an10.14:9.4.en: This is the first kind of emotional barrenness they’ve given up.

an10.14:10.6.pli: Yassa cittaṁ namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, evamassāyaṁ pañcamo cetokhilo pahīno hoti.
an10.14:10.6.en: This is the fifth kind of emotional barrenness they’ve given up.

an10.14:10.7.en: These are the five kinds of emotional barrenness they’ve given up.

an10.14:13.1.pli: Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā ime pañca cetokhilā pahīnā ime pañca cetasovinibandhā susamucchinnā, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no parihāni.
an10.14:13.1.en: A monk or nun who has given up these five kinds of emotional barrenness and has cut off these five emotional shackles can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

an10.14:14.2.pli: evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā ime pañca cetokhilā pahīnā ime pañca cetasovinibandhā susamucchinnā, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no parihānī”ti.
an10.14:14.2.en: In the same way, a monk or nun who has given up these five kinds of emotional barrenness and has cut off these five emotional shackles can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.”

2. A Protector
14. Emotional Barrenness

an5.205:1.1.en: “Mendicants, there are these five kinds of emotional barrenness.

an5.205:1.5.pli: Yassa cittaṁ na namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, ayaṁ paṭhamo cetokhilo.
an5.205:1.5.en: This is the first kind of emotional barrenness.

an5.205:2.6.pli: Yassa cittaṁ na namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, ayaṁ pañcamo cetokhilo.
an5.205:2.6.en: This is the fifth kind of emotional barrenness.

an5.205:2.7.en: These are the five kinds of emotional barrenness.”

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 5
21. With Kimbila
205. Emotional Barrenness

an9.71:1.1.en: “Mendicants, there are five kinds of emotional barrenness.

an9.71:1.5.pli: Yassa cittaṁ na namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, ayaṁ paṭhamo cetokhilo.
an9.71:1.5.en: This is the first kind of emotional barrenness.

an9.71:2.6.pli: Yassa cittaṁ na namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, ayaṁ pañcamo cetokhilo.
an9.71:2.6.en: This is the fifth kind of emotional barrenness.

an9.71:3.1.pli: Imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṁ cetokhilānaṁ pahānāya …pe… ime cattāro satipaṭṭhānā bhāvetabbā”ti.
an9.71:3.1.en: To give up these five kinds of emotional barrenness you should develop the four kinds of mindfulness meditation. …”

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 9
7. Mindfulness Meditation
71. Emotional Barrenness

dn33:2.1.78.pli: Yo so, āvuso, bhikkhu satthari kaṅkhati vicikicchati nādhimuccati na sampasīdati, tassa cittaṁ na namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, yassa cittaṁ na namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, ayaṁ paṭhamo cetokhilo.
dn33:2.1.78.en: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving. This is the first kind of emotional barrenness.

dn33:2.1.83.pli: Yo so, āvuso, bhikkhu sabrahmacārīsu kupito hoti anattamano āhatacitto khilajāto, tassa cittaṁ na namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, yassa cittaṁ na namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya, ayaṁ pañcamo cetokhilo.
dn33:2.1.83.en: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving. This is the fifth kind of emotional barrenness.

dn34:1.6.28.en: This is the first kind of emotional barrenness.

dn34:1.6.34.en: This is the fifth kind of emotional barrenness.

sn22.90:8.1.pli: “Ettakenapi mayaṁ āyasmato channassa attamanā api nāma taṁ āyasmā channo āvi akāsi khīlaṁ chindi.
sn22.90:8.1.en: “I’m already delighted with Venerable Channa. Hopefully you’ve opened yourself up and cut through your emotional barrenness.
